3: áṃśa, m. (that which one gets, i. e.) one's portion; and so, generalized, portion, part. [√1aś, ‘get.’]
4: aṃśú, m. juicy internodium or shoot of the Soma-plant; and so, shooting ray (of light).
5: aṃśumánt, a. rich in beams, radiant; as m. the sun, 164. [aṃśú, 1235b.]
6: áṃsa, m. shoulder. [perhaps, ‘the strong’ (part), √am, 1197a: cf. ὦμ-ος, Lat. um-erus, Goth. amsa, ‘shoulder.’]
7: a-kasmāt, adv. without any “wherefore”; without apparent cause; unexpectedly; accidentally.
8: akasmād-āgantu, m. an accidental arrival,  a chance comer.
9: a-kāra, m. the sound or letter a. [Whitney,  18.]
10: a-kāraṇa, n. lack of cause; -am, adv. causelessly.
14: aktú, m. 	—1. ointment; 	—2. light, beam of light; 	—3. night. [for 2, cf. ἀκτίς, ‘beam.’]
17: 1akṣá, n. for akṣán at end of cpds [1315a].
18: 2akṣá, m. a die for playing. [named, perhaps, from its ‘eyes’ (1akṣá) or ‘spots.’]
19: ákṣa, m. axle. [cf. ἄξων, Lat. axis, AS. eax, Eng. axe (i. e. ‘axle’), and axle.]
20: á-kṣata, a. unhurt, uninjured; unbroken; as m. pl. unbroken or unhusked grains, esp. of barley.
21: akṣata-kesara, a. having an uninjured mane.
22: akṣata-deha, a. having an unhurt or perfect body.
23: akṣán [431], n. eye. [cf. ὔπ-ωπ-α, ‘have seen,’ ὤψ, ‘eye’; ὄσσε, ‘eyes’; Lat. oc-ulus, ‘eye’; the kinship of AS. eāge, Eng. eye, remains to be proved: cf. √īkṣ.]
24: akṣa-priya, a. beloved of the dice, i. e. lucky at gaming.
25: a-kṣama, a. not equal to a thing; unable, w. inf.
28: a-kṣára, a. imperishable; as n. word; syllable; the sacred syllable, om, 6014; sound, letter, 614.
29: akṣara-nyāsa, m. the commitment to letters, the writing.
31: akṣārālavaṇa, n. that which is not pungent and not salt. [alavaṇa: 1253b.]
32: akṣārālavaṇāśin, a. eating that which is not pungent and not salt, abstaining from seasoned and salted food. [āśin.]
35: akṣauhiṇī-pati, m. master of an army; general.
36: a-khila, a. without a gap, entire; all.
37: a-gadá, a. not having disease, well, healthy, whole; wholesome; as m. medicine.
39: agní, m. fire; esp. a sacred fire; the god of fire, Agni, mediator between men and gods, messenger who carries the sacrifice to them, protector from the terrors and spirits of darkness, and keeper of house and hearth. [perhaps, ‘the quickly moving or agile one,’ √aj, 1158: cf. Lat. ignis, ‘fire,’ agilis, ‘agile’; akin, poss., is αἴγλη, ‘flashing light.’]
40: agni-kuṇḍa, n. round hole in the ground for the sacred fire.
41: agni-velā, f. fire-hour, time for kindling the sacred fire; afternoon.
42: agni-hotrá, n. fire-sacrifice (a burntoffering of fresh milk).
44: agny-ādhéya, n. placing or setting up of the sacred fire. [acct, 1272.]
45: ágra, n. 	—1. front; agre, in front, before, in presence of, w. gen.; 	—2. beginning; agre, in the beginning, in the first place, first; 	—3. tip, end. [perhaps, ‘that which goes before, leader,’ √aj: cf. ἄγω, ‘lead,’ στρατ-ηγός, ‘army-leader.’]
46: agratás, adv. in front [1098c8]; before (one's self); w. kṛ, place in front, cause to lead. [agra, 1098b.]
48: aghá, a. distressful, harmful; as n. harm, trouble, evil; sin; sorrow. [like aṃhú, ‘narrow,’ and áṃhas, ‘distress,’ from √*aṅgh or aṃh, ‘straiten’: cf. ἄχος, ‘distress’;  ἄγχω, Lat. ango, ‘strangle’; AS. ange, ‘anxious,’ Ger. enge, ‘narrow,’ Angst, ‘distress’: for connection of mgs, cf. Eng. straiten, ‘to narrow’ and ‘to distress.’]
51: á-ghnya, m. bull (the animal that is ‘hard to overcome,’ or more exactly, ‘not to be slain’).
52: ághnyā, f. cow. [formed as a pendant to aghnya.]
53: aṅká, m. 	—1. the bend at the groin made by taking a sitting position, lap; 	—2. the bend just above the hip (where babes, sitting astride, are carried by Hindu women --see āroha); 	—3. hook; 	—4. (like Eng. pot-hook) mark, sign. [√añc: for 1, cf. ἀγκών, ‘bend in arm or wall or shore’; for 3, cf. ὄγκος, Lat. uncus, AS. ongel, ‘hook’; cf. Eng. angle, not a borrowed word.]
54: √aṅkhaya (aṅkháyati [1056, 1067]). hook on, grapple. [from aṅka, ‘hook,’ despite the aspiration.] + pari, clasp, embrace.
56: aṅgá, asseverative particle. yád aṅgá, just when; té aṅgá, they only.
57: áṅga, n. limb, member; by synecdoche, body, person, form. [√aṅg: for mg, cf. aṅgúli, aṅgúṣṭha.]
59: aṅganā́, f. a (fair) form, i. e. a woman. [áṅga.]
61: áṅgiras, m. 	—1. orig., probably, messenger; esp. messenger between gods and men; by eminence, Agni; 	—2. as pl. Angirases, a name applied by the Hindus to a certain race among their forefathers (perhaps because their intercourse with the gods was conceived as very intimate), these forefathers being regarded as half divine; 	—3. as s. the (mythical) ancestor of the Angirases.
62: aṅgúli, f. finger. [√aṅg, 1191: for mg, cf. áṅga.]
63: aṅgúṣṭha, m. thumb. [for mg, cf. áṅga.]
64: √ac or añc (ácati, áñcati; akná, añcitá; -ácya). bend. [cf. aṅka and vbl añc.] + ā, bend.
65: a-cara, a. not moving; as subst. plant (as distinguished from animals).
66: a-cala, a. immovable; as m. mountain.
67: a-cít, a. not knowing; unwise; foolish.
71: áccha, vbl prefix. to, unto; hither; w. √√ 2naś, yā, vah, vṛt; often acchā, 248a.
72: √aj (ájati, -te). drive. [orig. ‘put in motion’: cf. Lat. ago, ‘lead, drive’; ἄγω, ‘lead’: cf. also agra, ajira, āji.] + ud, drive out.
73: ajá, m. he-goat. [prob. ‘the agile one,’ √aj: cf. αἴξ, ‘goat.’]
75: ajarāmaravat, adv. as if ageless and immortal. [ajara-amara, 1107, 1257.]
76: á-jasra, a. not dying out; perpetual (of fire).
79: ajína, m. goat-skin; pelt. [aja: cf. αἰγίς, ‘goat-skin, Aegis,’ w. αἴξ, ‘goat.’]
80: ajirá, a. agile, swift. [√aj, 1188c: cf. Lat. agilis, ‘agile.’]
82: a-jña, a. not knowing, ignorant; foolish; as m. fool.
83: á-jñāta, a. unknown. [√jñā: cf. ἄ-γνωτος, Lat. i-gnotus, Eng. un-couth, ‘unknown.’]
84: ajñāta-kulaśīla, a. whose family and character are unknown.
86: a-jñāna, n. ignorance; -āt and -atas, out of ignorance.
88: añc, as vbl at end of cpds [see 407-9], turning, directed; e. g. úd-añc, directed upward. [for mg, cf. Eng. -ward (in to-ward, etc.), which is akin w. √vṛt, ‘turn.’]
89: √añj or aj (anákti, aṅkté; ānáñja, ānajé [788]; ā́ñjīt; aktá; aktvā́; -áñjya, -ájya). 	—1. smear; anoint; 	—2. adorn. [cf. aktu: cf. Lat. ungo, ‘anoint.’] + ā, anoint. + vi, 	—1. anoint; 	—2. adorn; and so, bring to notice; vyàkta: adorned, fair; manifest;  --caus. make clear or manifest. + sam, 	—1. anoint; 	—2. adorn; 	—3. unite by anointing, 8919; 	—4. generalized, unite with, take to one's self (e. g. food), 8810.
90: añjalí, m. the two hollowed and open hands placed side by side; the hands so placed and raised to the forehead, i. e. a gesture of reverent salutation; a double handful (as measure).
91: áñjas, adv. quickly, suddenly. [prob. adv. acc. or instr. of an obsolete subst. áñjas, ‘a slippery way or a gliding motion,’ √añj.]
93: aṭanī, f. the notched end of a bow.
96: aṇḍa-ja, a. egg-born; as m. bird.
99: átas, adv. 	—1. (as abl. of pron. root a [1098], and synonymous w. asmāt) from it; so 229, sc. paṅkāt; ato ‘nya, other than it, 6812; 	—2. from this (place), 8315; 	—3. from this (time), 9621; cf. ūrdhvam; then, 4016; 	—4. from this (cause), 3510; therefore, 278, etc.; w. correl. yatas, 363; hence; and so, 394, 4221; so then, 7312. [pron. root a, 502.]
100: áti, adv. across, beyond, past, over, as vbl prefix; in cpds, to excess, excessive, see 1289b; as prep. beyond, over. [cf. ἔτι, ‘further, besides’; Lat. et, ‘besides, and.’]
101: atikrama, m. act of overstepping or overcoming.  [√kram + ati.]
104: ati-dūra, a. very far or distant; as n. great distance.
111: atīndriya, a. transcending the senses; as n. soul, spirit. [ati + indriya, 1310a.]
113: a-tyājya, a. not to be abandoned.
115: atyugra-puṇyapāpa, a. extraordinarily good and bad; as n. pl. extraordinarily good and bad deeds.
116: átra (átrā, 248a), adv. 	—1. (as loc. of pron. root a [10994], and synonymous w. asmin) substantively: in it, 9710; in this case, 315; in that case, 1817; on this point, 292; adjectively: w. antare: in this interim, meantime, 2419, 452, 5022, 554; on this occasion, at this juncture, 1911; atra sarasi, in this pool; 	—2. in this or that (place); here, 2516; there, 335, 894; in that world (opp. to ‘in this world’), 871, 7, 9; 	—3. in that (time), then, 5612. [pron. root a, 502.]
117: átri, m. Atri, name of a famous Rishi.
118: átha (áthā, 248a), adv. expresses a sequence, temporal or resultant: then; so; so then; accordingly; thereupon; 	—1. temporal: e. g. áti drava, áthā…úpehi, run past, and then go unto…, 8318; in apodosis after yadā́, 845, 6, 7, 9622; 	—2. resultant: e. g. marúdbhiḥ sakhyáṃ te astu, átha jayāsi, make friends with the Maruts, and then (if thou dost) thou shalt conquer, 822N.; 	—3. very frequent as a simple continuative: now; so; then; usually at beginning of sentence (e. g. 201) or śloka (e. g. 26); sometimes within the śloka (e. g. 314); exceptionally at the end, 139; at beginning of section or book, now, 9816; here beginneth (cf. íti), 11; sometimes much attenuated in meaning; often almost equivalent to a capital letter, to mark the beginning of a new clause, e. g. 9418; connecting parts of sentence, 411; 	—4. pleonastically w. tatas, 139; mere verse-filler, 1019; 	—5. átho, i. e. átha u, and also, 9016; 	—6. serving as a point d'appui for an enclitic, which may thus precede its word: e. g. devo, ‘tha vā yakṣas, a god or a Yaksha, instead of devo, yakṣo vā, 818; so 212; in this use, vā: atha vā:: que: atque; cf. 2721; cf. vā; 	—7. atha vā, or rather, 267N. [pron. root a, 1101, 502; later form of ádhā (which is more common in the Veda): cf. Lat. at, ‘then, further, but.’]
119: √ad (átti; atsyáti; áttum). eat; consume. [cf. ἔδω, Lat. edo, AS. etan, Eng. eat: cf. anna.]
120: ád, vbl. eating, consuming, in cpds.
122: a-daṃṣṭrin, a. without tusks or large teeth.
124: a-dantajāta, a. not having teethed. [‘not having grown teeth,’ for a-jātadanta. ]
125: adás [501], pron. yon, yonder, that, that there, in opposition to the one here or just mentioned: e. g. asau, 227, that one (the traveller--last mentioned at 2019); so 3110; asāv amutra, ayam asmin, that one in that world, this one in this, 1037; that one (correl. ya), 76, 3711; as designation of persons not to be named, so-and-so, N. or M.; asāv aham, I am so-and-so, 6114; 6021; 1035; follows at a distance the word to which it refers, thus emphasizing it, 231. [see 501 and 503.]
126: áditi, a. without bond or limit; infinite; as f. infinity, the endless heaven, 7919; infinity,  personified as a goddess, Aditi, 758. [apparently a + *diti, acct, 1304a2: diti, ‘bond,’ would be a reg. deriv. of √3dā, ‘bind,’ but does not occur as such, although there is a word díti, q. v., of quite different mg and origin.]
128: adīnātman, a. with cheerful spirit, undaunted.  [ātman.]
129: á-durmaṅgala, f. -ī, a. bringing no bad luck. [for declension, cf. sumaṅgála, -galī́, and 355b.]
131: adṛṣṭa-kāma, m. love for one not yet seen.
132: a-devá, m. non-god, who is no god. [1288a4.]
134: ádbhuta, a. wonderful; as n. wonder. [despite anatidbhuta, prob. from at(i)bhūta, ‘transcending what has existed,’ 1310a: cf. ambara.]
136: adyá, adv. to-day; adya niśi, in this night (just past), 518; now; adya yāvat, until now; adya_ārabhya, from now on. [perhaps from *a-dyavi, ‘on this day,’ 1122f, see dyu: cf. Lat. ho-die, ‘to-day.’]
138: ádri, m. rock; stone; esp. Soma-stone (for bruising the Soma); missile stone.
139: adrivant, a. having or armed with the hurling-stone.
140: ádha (ádhā, 248a), Vedic adv. expressing a sequence: then, so, 798; so then, 8918; adha yad, just then when, 7614; (then, i. e. besides, i. e.) and, 7718, 786. [11043: cf. átha.]
142: adhamá [525], a. lowest; worst. [cf. adhas and 474: cf. Lat. infimus, ‘lowest.’]
143: ádhara [525], a. lower. [cf. adhas and 474: cf. Lat. inferus, ‘lower’; Eng. under.]
145: adhaḥ-śāyin, a. lying low, i. e. sleeping on the ground.
147: adhástāt, adv. below; as prep., w. gen. [1130], under. [adhas, 1100b.]
148: ádhi, adv. over, besides, in addition, 9616; as prep. above, over, on; w. instr. (of snú only), away over, 7911; w. abl. from, out of, 1034; w. loc.: over, 907; on, 7013, 9211.
149: adhika, a. (like Eng. over in adj. uses) additional;  surpassing the usual measure, superior, extraordinary; as n. surplus. [ádhi, 1222a.]
150: adhika-rūpavant, a. surpassingly or most beautiful.
151: adhikānurāga, m. superior affection or most affection. [anurāga.]
152: adhikāra, m. authority; office; duties of office. [√1kṛ + adhi, ‘put over or in office.’]
153: ádhijya, a. having the bow-string up or on, i. e. strung. [2jyā́, 1305.]
157: adhiṣṭhā́na, n. standing-place; (of the soul) a dwelling-place or manifestation. [√sthā + adhi.]
159: adho-nivīta, a. having the sacred cord (worn) low. [adhas.]
160: adhyayana, n. reading; study, esp. of the Veda. [√i + adhi, 1150. 1a.]
161: adhyāya, m. reading; study, esp. of the Veda; (like Eng. lesson), lectio, chapter, 5616, 5815, etc. [√i + adhi, 1148. 2.]
162: adhvará, m. religious or liturgical service;  sacrifice, esp. Soma-sacrifice.
164: adhvaryú, m. priest, who did the actual work of the sacrifice, and appears in the oldest period as companion of the hotṛ--see ṛtvij. [√adhvarya, 1178h.]
165: an, before consonants a, negative prefix. [1121a; acct, 1288a, 1304a: cf. ἀν-, ἀ-, Lat. in-, Eng. un-.]
166: √an (ániti [631]; ā́na; ā́niṣus; aniṣyáti; anitá; ánitum; -ánya). breathe, blow; live. [cf. anila, ἄνεμος, Lat. anima, ‘current of air’; Goth. an-an, ‘breathe.’] + pra, breathe.
172: an-antará, 	—1. a. having no interval; immediately adjoining; -am, adv. immediately afterwards, afterwards; thereupon; 	—2. as n. non-interval, in sam-.
173: an-amīvá, a. without sickness or trouble, well; as n. weal. [ámīvā, 1304a.]
174: an-arghya, a. not to be priced, priceless.
178: an-avadyá, a. not un-praiseworthy; blameless, faultless.
179: anavadyāṅga, f. -ī, a. having a faultless body. [áṅga.]
180: an-avekṣa, a. without any looking around; -am, adv. without looking around. [avekṣā.]
181: an-avekṣamāṇa, a. not looking around. [√īkṣ + ava.]
184: ánaṣṭa-paśu, a. who loses nothing from his herd. [prop. ‘having a not lost herd.’]
185: ánas, n. cart for heavy burden. [cf. Lat. onus, ‘burden.’]
186: án-āgata, a. not arrived; not (yet) come, impending, future. [√gam + ā.]
187: anāgatavant, a. having to do with the future. [1233.]
188: anāgata-vidhātṛ, m. arranger for the future; Forethought, name of a fish.
191: an-āmayá, a. without disease, healthy; as n. health.
194: an-āruhya, grd. without going into (danger). [√ruh + ā.]
196: á-niviśamāna, a. not going to rest. [acct, 1283.]
197: a-niveśaná, a. having no resting-place, unsettled. [nivéśana, 1304a.]
198: an-iṣṭa, a. undesired; disagreeable; unapproved,  unlawful. [√1iṣ.]
199: aniṣṭa-cintana, n. the thinking about something unlawful.
201: ánīka, n. 	—1. face; 	—2. fig. appearance; 	—3. of a hatchet (face, i. e.), sharp edge; 	—4. front, and so, by synecdoche, troop. [so Lat. acies has mgs 3 and 4.]
202: a-nītijña, a. not knowing discreet conduct.
203: ánu, prep. after, along, toward; w. acc. along or over; after, i. e. according to.
204: anugati, f. a going after. [√gam + anu.]
205: anucará, a. going after; as m. attendant; companion. [√car + anu.]
206: anu-jīvin, a. living upon, dependent; as m. a dependent. [√jīv + anu.]
208: á-nutta, a. un-moved, i. e. invincible. [√nud.]
209: anuttama, a. most highest; best, most excellent; supreme. [lit. ‘most best,’ formal superl. to anuttara, which is itself logically a superl.]
210: an-uttara, a. not having a superior, i. e. best. [for mg, cf. niḥśreyasa.]
214: an-upakārin, a. not doing or unable to do a friendly service.
215: anu-pūrva, a. following the one preceding,  one after another; -ám, adv. in regular order. [1310a.]
216: ánumati, f. approbation; favor (of gods to the pious); personified, Grace. [√man + anu.]
217: anumāna, n. the forming of a conception. [√1mā + anu, ‘conceive.’]
220: anurodhin, a. having (some) regard for. [√1rudh + anu.]
221: an-ulbaṇá, a. not lumpy; smooth or perfect (of a weft). [1288a4.]
222: anuvṛtti, f. sequence, and so, continuance.  [√vṛt + anu.]
223: ánu-vrata, a. acting according to the will or command (of another), obedient; devoted to, w. acc. [272], 616, 1004. [1310a: cf. apavrata.]
224: anuśaya, m. repentance. [perhaps ‘that which lies down after one or follows one to his bed’: √śī + anu.]
225: anuṣṭhāna, n. devotion to, observance. [√sthā + anu.]
226: anuṣṭheya, grdv. to be accomplished. [see √sthā + anu, and 963a.]
227: anusaraṇa, n. a going after, a searching. [√sṛ + anu.]
228: anustaraṇa, a. strewing over, covering over; --f. anustáraṇī (sc. go), a cow, slaughtered at the funeral ceremony, and the pieces of which are used for covering over the corpse, limb by limb. [√stṛ + anu.]
230: an-ṛta, a. untrue; ánṛta, n. untruth; wrong. [ṛtá, 1288a.]
231: an-eka, a. not one, i. e. more than one; many.
234: á-nedya, a. not to be blamed; blameless.  [acct, 1285a.]
236: an-oṃkṛta, a. not having om uttered, i. e. unaccompanied by om. [see oṃkṛta.]
237: ánta, m. 	—1. vicinity, proximity; 	—2. border; limit; end. [see ánti: cf. Eng. end.]
238: antaḥ-pura, n. inner stronghold or citadel; inner apartment of the royal citadel, gynaeceum, harem, 221. [antar, 1289a.]
240: anta-kara, a. end-making; as m. destroyer.
241: ántama, a. nearest, very near; as m. intimate,  companion. [see ánta, mg 1, and 474: cf. Lat. intumus, ‘inmost.’]
242: antár, adv. inward, inwardly, within; prep., w. loc.: between, among, within; along with, 7812; cf. √√i, gam, dhā. [cf. Lat. inter, ‘between.’]
243: 1ántara, a. very near, only in V. and B. [see ánta, mg 1, and 474.]
244: 2ántara, a. inner; as n. 	—1. the interior, middle; jala_antare, in the middle of the water = in the water, 507; vana_antarasaṃcārin, wandering in the forest, 4913; 	—2. interval--see atra; --3. distance between two things; the difference, 297; 	—4. difference, at end of cpds [1302e 5]: …-antara, that which has a difference of…, i. e. another…, 331, 3812, 23, 436; 	—5. occasion, juncture, 1911. [antár: cf. ἔντερα, ‘inwards, guts.’]
245: antar-ātman, m. the in(-dwelling) soul; heart. [1289.]
246: antári-kṣa, n. the atmosphere, see 929 N. [‘lying or situate in the middle’ between heaven and earth: antar + kṣa: for mg, cf. τὸ μεσηγό, as used of the aerial space traversed by Iris.]
247: antarikṣa-ga, a. moving in the air; as m. bird. [for mg, cf. khaga.]
248: antarikṣa-loká, m. atmosphere-world [1280b]; the atmosphere, regarded as a separate world.
249: antar-gata, a. gone within, i. e. being within; hidden.
250: antardhāna, n. a hiding; disappearance; w. i, disappear. [√1dhā + antar, q. v.]
252: antar-vedi, a. situate within the sacrificial bed; -dí, adv. within the sacrificial spot. [1310a.]
253: ánti, adv. opposite, in front, before; near. [see ánta: cf. ἀντί, ‘opposite,’ ἄντα, ‘face to face’; Lat. ante, ‘before’; antīcus, ‘former, ancient’; AS. and-swaru, Eng. an-swer.]
254: 1antiká, n. neighborhood or presence; used like samīpa, q. v. [ánti.]
255: 2antika, for anta at end of cpds, 1222, 1307; grahaṇa_antika, having acquisition as its conclusion.
256: antimá, a. last. [ánti, 474: for mg (‘endmost’ ?), cf. ánta 2, and antya.]
257: ante-vāsín, m. pupil. [lit. ‘abiding ina the vicinity,’ 1250c.]
258: antya, a. being at the end, last; lowest; of lowest caste. [ánta.]
260: antyajātitā, f. condition of having lowest birth. [1237.]
261: antya-strī, f. woman of lowest caste.
264: ánna, n. food; esp. rice, usually boiled, the chief food of the Hindus; grain. [√ad, 1177a: cf. εἶδαρ, Lat. esca, *ed-ca, ‘food’; ador, ‘spelt’; AS. āta, Eng. oat.]
265: anna-prāśana, n. rice-feeding, the first feeding of an infant with rice.
268: anyá [523], pron. a. another, other, else; anyac ca, and another thing, i. e. again, see ca 3; other than, different from, w. abl., 34, 2419, 6812, 10414; otiose, 212; yad anyat kiṃ cana, whatever else, 916; anya or eka…anya, the one…the other, 9013, 298. [cf. ἔνιοι, ‘some’; Goth. an-an–þarar, ‘other,’ Eng. other.]
269: anyatama, a. one of several, some one. [anya, 5253.]
270: anyátas, adv. from another direction [1098b], otherwise; elsewhere [1098c3], to another place. [anya.]
271: anyáthā, adv. otherwise, 189; w. bhū, become otherwise, suffer change, 175; otherwise than it really is, falsely, 3520; otherwise (i. e. if not), 488. [anya.]
273: anye-dyús, adv. on the next day. [‘altero die’: 1250c.]
274: anyonya, pron. a. one the other, for anyò ‘nyá [175a], the first part being a crystallized nom. s. m. [1314c]; w. value of gen., anyonyam prati hṛcchaya = anyasya_anyam prati h., love of one towards the other, 219. [see paraspara.]
275: anváñc [409c], a. directed after, following after, being behind. [ánu + áñc.]
277: áp [393], f. plurale tantum. water; waters. [unrelated to Lat. aqua, ‘water,’ Goth. ahva, ‘stream.’]
278: ápa, prep. away, forth, off; opp. of úpa, see √√i, kṛ. [cf. ἀπό, Lat. ab, ‘from’; Eng. off, of.]
281: apacāra, m. going off; absence. [√car + apa.]
282: á-patighnī, a. f. not husband-slaying. [402: acct, 1288a.]
283: ápatya, n. offspring; child; young (of animals). [ápa, ‘off,’ 1245b.]
285: apabhraṣṭa, a. fallen off; deviating (from good grammar); provincial. [√bhraṃś + apa.]
286: ápara [525], pron. a. hinder, opp. of pūrva; following a former one (pūrva), 8613; later; westerly, opp. to pūrva--cf. prāñc; a following one, i. e. an other; aparaṃ ca, and another thing, and further, see ca 3; --aparī́ [cf. 355b], f. pl. the future (days), the future. [lit. ‘remoter,’ fr. ápa, 474.]
287: a-parāṅmukha, a. not having an averted face, i. e. not turning the back, 519.
288: á-parājita, a. unconquered; w. diś, the northeast quarter, 9923N. [√ji.]
290: a-parijāta, a. not completely grown (of an embryo), i. e. prematurely born, stillborn.  [see pari-jāta and ref.]
291: a-pariṇīya, grd. without any leading around. [√nī.]
293: ápa-vrata, a. disobedient; stubborn. [‘away from command,’ 1310a: cf. ánuvrata. ]
295: ápas, n. work. [perhaps from √*ap, ‘reach, take hold of’--see √āp: cf. Lat. opus, ‘work.’]
296: apāya, m. a going away; what takes one from the mark (cf. upāya); danger; disadvantage; diminution. [√i + apa, 1148. 1a: for mg, cf. Eng. untoward.]
298: ápi, indecl. unto, close upon or on; 	—1. prep. to, w. √gam; 	—2. adv. (thereto, besides,  i. e.) further, also; connecting clauses (6323) or words (6511); connecting sentences, api ca, and besides, 299, see ca 3; …api …api, both…and, 5423; …, …ca api, and, 512, 265; …ca, …cāpi, both…and also, 121; …, …caiva, …cāpi, 6515; …cāpi, …ca, 321, 1611; …cāpi, …ca, …ca, 166, 6010; na…, na_api…, neither…, nor…, 99; na…, na cāpi, 2212; na…, na…, …api ca, neither…, nor…, nor also…, 212;…, …vā, …vā_api, either…, or…, or even…, 622; 	—3. also, too, immediately following the emphasized word, 612, 113, 2118, 2421; mām api, me too, 4120; 	—4. even, immediately following the emphasized word, and often marking a circumstance under which a thing is true where this is not to be expected: e. g. 213, 287, 18, 3319; tathā_api, so even, i. e. nevertheless, 2111; concessively, although, 291, 2114, 511, 5; w. na, not even, 1915; w. indefinites, kadā cid api na, not ever at all, 3114, 323; 	—5. but, immediately following a new subject, after change of subject, 615, 2821, 3222, 4117, 20, 21; 	—6. at least, 289, 11; 	—7. converts an interr. into an indef. [507]; so ka, 1711, etc.; katham, 511. [cf. ἐπί, ‘on, upon’; perhaps Lat. op-, ob-, ‘unto, on.’]
300: a-pūrvá, a. having no predecessor; unprecedented;  incomparable. [pū́rva: acct, 1304a.]
302: á-praja, a. having no offspring, childless. [prajā, 367b.]
303: a-prajñāta, a. undistinguished or not clearly to be known. [√jñā.]
305: a-pratima, a. without match or equal; unequalled. [pratimā, 367b.]
306: á-pratīta, a. not gone against; not withstood;  invincible. [√i + prati.]
307: a-pratta, a. not given (in marriage). [√1dā + pra, 1087e.]
308: á-prayucchant, a. not heedless; watchful.  [√2yu + pra, q. v.]
309: á-priya, a. not dear; disliked; disagreeable.
310: apsarás, f. one of a class of semi-divine beings, wives of the Gandharvas; an Apsaras,  6712N. [1151. 2d.]
312: ábda, m. lit. water-giving; (then, perhaps, rainy season, and so) year. [ap + da, but w. irreg. acct, 1269: for mg, see varṣa.]
313: a-bhakṣya, a. not to be eaten; as n. that which ought not to be eaten.

316: a-bhāvin, a. not about to be, not destined to be.
317: abhí, adv. to, unto; against; frequent as vbl prefix; as prep. unto, w. acc. [cf. ἀμφί, ‘around’; Lat. ambi-, amb-, ‘on both sides, around’; AS. ymbe, Ger. um, ‘around’; for mg, cf. abhitas.]
318: abhijña, a. knowing, acquainted with. [√jñā + abhi, 333.]
319: abhítas, adv. on both sides; on all sides, 10110; around; near. [abhí.]
321: abhidhā́, f. name; cf. ākhyā. [√1dhā + abhi, q. v.]
323: abhidhyāna, n. the thinking upon. [√dhyā + abhi.]
326: abhíbhūti, f. superiority; as a. [1157. 2], superior. [√bhū + abhi.]
328: abhímāti, f. hostile plot; concrete, plotter,  foe. [√man + abhi, 1157. 1d: ā irreg.]
329: abhi-mukha, a. having the face towards; facing; turned towards. [1305.]
330: abhivāda, m. salutation; at 6022, signification.  [√vad + abhi.]
334: abhi-śiras, a. having the head towards, w. acc. [1305.]
336: abhīpsu, a. desirous of obtaining, w. acc. [√āp + abhi, 1178f, 1038.]
338: abhy-antara, a. situated in the inside [1310a]; as n. interior; interval.
339: abhy-ātma, a. directed towards one's self [1310a]; -ám, adv. towards one's self [1310d].
340: abhyāsa, m. study. [√2as + abhi, q. v.]
341: abhrá, n. rain-cloud. [cf. ὄμβος, ‘rain’; Lat. imber, ‘rain’: cf. ámbhas and ambu, ‘water.’]

343: √am (ámīti [634]; āmé; āmáyati). press on violently; harm; caus. [10412], harm; be sick. [cf. aṃsa.]
344: áma, pron. this; he. [5034: cf. amā́.]
346: a-mára, a. deathless; immortal; as m. an immortal, a god; -vat [1107], adv. like a god. [mará: 1304a2 end.]
352: amā́, adv. at home, chez soi; amā kṛ, keep by one. [áma, 1112a and e.]
353: amā́tya, m. inmate of the same house, relative. [amā́, 1245b.]
355: amā-vāsa, m. a dwelling (of the moon) at home (i. e. with the sun).

357: a-mithuna, a. not forming pairs (of both sexes).
358: a-mīmāṃsya, a. not to be called in question.

360: amīva-cā́tana, f. -ī, a. driving away disease. [1271.]
361: amīva-hán [402], a. slaying the tormenting spirits.
363: amútas, adv. from there, opp. of itas; there. [amu.]

370: ambu-ja, a. water-born; as n. lotus.
372: áya, a. subst. going, a going. [√i, 1148. 1a b.]

376: a-yúj, a. not paired; in uneven numbers. [cf. ἄ-ζυξ, ‘unyoked.’]

383: áraṇya, n. wilderness, forest. [‘strange land,’ fr. áraṇa.]

393: aruṇá, a. ruddy; as m. Aruna, name of a teacher, 9511. [cf. aruṣá.]

395: aruṣá, f. áruṣī, a. ruddy. [see 362b2: cf. aruṇá.]
396: are, word of address. Ah! [voc. of ari, 1135c: cf. re.]
397: a-roga, a. not having disease, diseaseless.
400: arghya, a. of price or that may be priced. [argha, 1212.]
406: ártha, m. 	—1. aim, object, purpose, errand,  sake; artham and arthe [1302c 4], for the sake of, on account of, for, esp. frequent at end of cpds; 	—2. (object, i. e.) thing, matter, affair, cause, business; 	—3. (object, i. e.) advantage, profit (w. instr.), wealth, property; 	—4. aim, intent, meaning,  5915. [‘that which one goes for,’ √ṛ, 1163.]
407: artha-tattva, n. true state of the matter or case.
408: √arthaya (artháyate, -ti). seek for an object. [artha, 1067.] + abhi, ask, entreat. + pra, desire, sue for.

410: arthín, a. having an object, desiring, seeking; (begging, i. e.) needy. [artha.]
412: ardhá, a. half; as m. the half.

418: aryá, a. faithful; attached, kindly, 793. [‘going eagerly to,’ √ṛ: cf. ā́rya.]

427: álam, adv. enough; sometimes equiv. to an adj., adequate, fitting, ready; --w. instr. enough with, have done with; --w. kṛ, make ready, adorn; sv-alaṃkṛta, well adorned; sam-alaṃkṛta, well (sam intens., 1077b) adorned. [later form of áram.]
429: a-lasá, a. not lively; without energy; slothful; tired.
430: a-lobha, m. non-greed; absence of cupidity.
432: alpa-dhī, a. small-minded, of small intelligence.
433: alpaśás, adv. to a small degree. [alpa.]
434: √av (ávati; ā́va; ā́vīt; aviṣyáti; ūtá; -ávya). 	—1. set a-going; 	—2. further, favor, wish well; 	—3. refresh; 	—4. have pleasure in (acc.). [cf. Lat. avēre, ‘have pleasure in,’ ave, ‘hail.’] + pra, show forth favor; then, be attentive or heedful (as, conversely, in Eng. attention has come to mean ‘act of kindness or courtesy’).
436: ávakā, f. grassy swamp-plant, Blyxa octandra Richard.
437: avakāśá, m. 	—1. open place; 	—2. (place, and so) opportunity. [√kāś + ava.]
438: avajñā, f. contempt. [√jñā + ava: for mg, cf. avamāna.]
439: avatāra, m. descent, esp. of supernatural beings to the earth; an epiphany; incarnation,  Anglo-Indian avatár. [√tṛ + ava.]
442: a-vadyá, a. un-praiseworthy; as n. imperfection.  [1285.]
444: a-vadhyá, a. not to be harmed, inviolable.  [vádhya, 1285.]
446: avanata-kāya, a. with bent down body, 3417. [√nam.]
447: avamāna, m. contempt; self-contempt, 5014. [√man + ava: for mg, cf. avajñā.]
448: avalambitavya, grdv. to be held on to. [√lamb + ava.]
449: a-vaśá, a. not willing or submissive; uncontrolled.  [váśa: acct, 1288a4.]
450: avaśyam, adv. necessarily, surely. [fr. an unused adj. a-vaśya, ‘unyielding.’]
452: avás, adv. downwards; w. abl. [1128], down from [cf. áva.]
454: avasara, m. occasion. [√sṛ + ava: for mg, cf. Lat. cāsus, ‘occasion,’ w. cadere, ‘fall,’ and Ger. Fall, ‘case, instance,’ w. fallen, ‘fall.’]
455: avasā́na, n. place of rest. [√sā + ava.]
456: avasthā́, f. state, condition. [√sthā + ava: for mg, cf. Lat. status w. stāre.]
457: a-vahant, a. not flowing, standing. [√vah, mg 4.]
458: a-vācya, a. not to be spoken to.
459: ávāñc [409a], a. directed downwards; acc. s. n. avāk, adv. downwards, in depth.
460: ávi, m. sheep; as f. ewe. [cf. ὄις, *ὄϝις, Lat. ovis, ‘sheep’; Eng. ewe.]
465: a-vidāsin, a. not drying up, perennial. [√das.]
466: á-vidvāṃs, a. unwise; as m. fool. [acct, 1288a.]
468: a-vidhānatas, adv. not according to regulation.
469: a-vipluta, a. not dishonored; unsullied. [√plu + vi, q. v.]
473: a-viṣaya, m. a non-province; something out of one's line or that one has no business to do; unlawful thing.
474: a-vṛká, a. not harmful; -ám, adv. harmlessly,  lovingly. [vṛ́ka: acct, 1288a4.]
475: avekṣā, f. a looking around. [√īkṣ + ava, 11493.]
476: a-vyakta, a. not manifest; as m. The All-soul, 6717. [√añj.]
477: a-vyaya, a. imperishable; not subject to change; unbroken. [1288a.]
478: √1aś, orig. aṃś (aśnóti, aśnuté; ānáṃśa, ānaśé [7884]; ā́ṣṭa; aṣṭá; áśitum). reach; attain; obtain, get. [cf. ποδ-ηνεκ-ής, ‘reaching to the feet’; ἤν-εγκ-α, ‘carried’: see also the closely related √2naś.] + upa, attain to.
479: √2aś (aśnā́ti; ā́śa; ā́śīt; aśiṣyáti; aśitá; áśitum; aśitvā́; -áśya). partake of; taste; eat. [a specialization of √1aś: cf. ἄκ-ολος, ‘bit’: for mg, cf. bhakṣ.] + pra, partake of; caus. feed.
482: a-śaṅka, a. without hesitation. [śaṅkā: cf. aviśaṅka.]
486: á-śeva, a. not dear; hostile. [śéva: acct, 1288a.]
487: a-śeṣa, a. without remainder, entire; -tas, adv. entirely, without exception.
488: áśman, m. 	—1. stone; 	—2. thunderbolt; 	—3. vault of heaven, 799. [cf. ἄκμων, ‘anvil, thunderbolt’; kinship w. Eng. hammer uncertain.]
491: áśva, m. horse; áśvā, f. mare, steed. [cf. ἵππος, dialectic ἵκκος, Lat. equus, Old Saxon ëhu, AS. eh, eoh, ‘horse.’]
492: aśva-kovida, a. well skilled in horses.
494: aśvín, a. horsed; as dual m. the Aśvins, gods of the morning light, 8515N. [aśva.]
495: áśvya, a. consisting of horses; of a horse. [aśva: cf. ἵππιος, ‘of a horse.’]
496: aṣṭá [4833], num. eight. [cf. ὀκτώ, Lat. octō, AS. eahta, Eng. eight.]
498: aṣṭa-vidha, a. of eight sorts; eight-fold. [vidhā, 1302c 5.]
500: aṣṭāṅga-pāta, m. a fall on eight members,  i. e. on hands, knees, feet, breast, and face, i. e. a most profound obeisance.
502: √1as (ásti [636]; ā́sa). 	—1. be, exist; be present or on hand; take place, happen; asti, āsīt, there is, there was, very frequent at beg. of stories; 	—2. be, w. predicate possessive gen., i. e. belong to; asti mama, I have; observe that Skt. has no verb for ‘have’; 	—3. most frequent as simple copula; further, w. ppls: e. g. prāpto ‘si, art thou come, didst thou come, 91; hantavyo 'smi, occidendus sum, 32; śepāno 'smi, I have sworn, 977; redundantly [303b4 end]: e. g. tathā_anuṣṭhite sati, it being thus performed,  3517; so 3713, 3916, 22; prahṛṣṭaḥ san, being pleased, 4812; 	—4. w. advs: tūṣṇīm āsīt, kept silent; evam astu, so be it; w. prādus, see s. v.; 	—5. become, 9619. [w. ás-ti, s-ánti, ‘is, are,’ cf. ἔσ-τι, ‘ís, exists,’ εἰσί, Doric ἐντί, *ἅντι, ‘are,’ Lat. es-t, s-unt, AS. is, *is-t, s-ind, ‘is, are,’ Eng. is; cognate are a-m, ar-t, are.]
503: √2as (ásyati, -te; ā́sa; asiṣyáti; astá; ásitum; asitvā́; -ásya). throw, cast, shoot; throw aside. [cf. así, ‘the brandished’ sword; Lat. ensis, ‘sword’; ālea, *aslea, ‘die,’ like Ger. Würfel, ‘die,’ fr. werfen, ‘throw.’] + vy-ati, throw over, cross. + abhi, throw (one's self) upon, direct (one's attention) to, study. [for mg, cf. προσέχειν without τὸν νοῦν.] + ni, throw down; deposit; commit. + pari-ni, throw down over, stretch over. + nis, throw out; root out; destroy. + vi, 	—1. cast asunder; cast or throw away; 	—2. break in pieces, 7014. + sam, cast or put together.
504: a-saṃhrādayant, a. not causing to rattle. [√hrād.]
506: á-sant, a. non-existing; as n. non-existence.
507: a-sapiṇḍa, a. related more distantly than in the sixth generation, see sapiṇḍa.
510: a-sambaddha, a. un-connected, in-coherent,  w. same fig. mg as in Eng. [√bandh.]
514: ásu, m. vital spirit; vigorous life. [√1as.]
517: ásu-nīti, f. the leading or continuing of life (in the other world); spirit-life; spirit-world.  [acct, 1274.]
518: a-sunvá, a. not pressing (Soma), i. e. indifferent to the gods, godless. [see 1148. 3b and 716.]
519: ásura, 	—1. a. spiritual (used of the gods, and designating esp. the difference between celestial and mundane existence); 	—2. as m. a spirit of life, a god; ásura adevá, spirit that is no god, demon, 826; 	—3. later, demon (456), enemy of the gods, an Asura, a not-god (as if the word were a-sura--whence, by popular etymology,  the pendant sura, ‘god’). [asura, 1226 (cf. 1188f), and as-u fr. √1as, 1178b.]
520: asuryà, a. godlike; as n. pl. godhead. [ásura, 1212d 4.]
525: ásta, n. home; ástam, w. i, gam, yā, go home; esp. of the sun [see 1092b], set. [prob. √1as: for mg, cf. bhavana.]
526: asta-mauna, a. having thrown aside or abandoned silence. [√2as.]
528: asthán [431], n. bone. [cf. ὀστέον, Lat. stem ossi-, *osti-, nom. os, ‘bone.’]
532: asmá [494], pron. stem. we, us. [cf. ἡμεῖς, Lesbian ἄμμες, ‘we.’]
533: asmád, as stem in cpds [494], our; as pl. majestaticus, my.
536: a-svastha, a. not well, ill; not self-contained,  not master of one's self.
538: √ah (ā́ttha, ā́ha, āháthus, -tus, āhús [801a]). say; call; āhus, they say. [cf. Lat. aio, ‘say,’ ad-ag-ium, ‘saw, proverb,’ nego, ‘say no.’] + pra, declare to be.
539: 1áha, assev. particle. certainly, of course; namely. [pron. root a: cf. 11043 end.]
541: á-hata, a. 	—1. not beaten; 	—2. (since Hindu washermen wet the clothes and pound them with stones) unwashed, of a garment, i. e. new. [√han.]
542: áhan, áhar, áhas [430a], n. day (as opp. to night), e. g. 9216; day.
543: ahám [491], pron. I. [cf. ἐγώ, Lat. ego, AS. ic, Eng. I: see 491 and ma etc.]
545: ahar-niśa, n. day and night, νυχθήμερον; -am, adv. constantly. [niśā: 1253b.]
549: ahaha, excl. of joy or sorrow. [1135a.]
550: a-hārya, a. not liable to be stolen.
551: ahāryatva, n. non-liability to be stolen. [1239.]
552: áhi, m. serpent; esp. the dragon of the sky, often identified w. the demon Vritra. [see under agha: cf. ἔχις, Lat. anguis, ‘serpent’;  ἔγχελυς, Lat. anguilla, ‘cel.’]
554: áhi-gopā [352], a. having the dragon as their keeper. [13021.]
556: ahi-hátya, n. the slaying of the dragon; the (victorious) fight with the dragon. [acct, 1272a, 1213c.]
558: aho, excl. of astonishment, pleasant or unpleasant. [1135a: euphony, 138f.]
559: aho-rātrá, n. day and night, νυχθήμερον. [áhas + rā́tri, 1253b: see rātra.]
560: ā́, adv. 	—1. hither, unto, as prefix w. verbs of motion; 	—2. conjunctively, thereto, besides;  ca…ā, both…and, 855; 	—3. asseveratively, (up to, i. e.) quite, entirely, 7320; 	—4. as prep., w. abl.: hither from, all the way from; and then [293c], all the way to, until, 4913, 6414, 10320, 1056, 1062; as far as, 10510. [cf. Lat. ā, ‘from,’ which is not akin w. ab, ‘from.’]
561: ākará, m. 	—1. accumulation, abundance; 	—2. mine. [√3kṛ + ā, q. v.]
562: √ākaraṇaya (ākarṇayati; ākarṇita; ākarṇya). listen; give ear to; hear. [denom. fr. the possessive adj. *ākarṇa, ‘having the ear to, i. e. listening.’]
563: ākarṣaka, a. attractive; --f. -ikā [1222d], Pleasanton, as name of a town. [√kṛṣ + ā.]
564: ākarṣikākhya, a. having the name ākarṣikā. [ākhyā.]
565: ākāra, m. make; shape; appearance. [√1kṛ + ā: cf. ākṛti.]
566: ākāravant, a. like the Eng. shapely. [ākāra.]
567: ākāśá, in Veda, m.; later, n. free or open space; sky. [prop. ‘outlook, clearness,’ √kāś + ā.]
568: ākula, a. 	—1. bestrewn, covered, filled; 	—2. fig. confused; agitated. [√3kṛ + ā, q. v.]
569: √ākulaya (ākulayati). confuse; ākulita, at one's wit's end. [ākula.]
571: ā́kṛti, f. make; shape; appearance. [√1kṛ + ā, 1157. 1d: cf. ākāra.]
572: ākhú, m. mold-warp; mouse. [‘burrower,’ √khā + ā, 1178a end.]
573: ākhyā, f. name; at end of cpds, having… as name. [√khyā + ā.]
576: āgantu, m. arrival; and so, as in Eng., person arriving. [√gam + ā, 1161.]
577: āgamana, n. a coming hither; w. punar, a returning. [√gam + ā.]
578: ā́gas, n. sin. [orig., perhaps, ‘a slip,’ √añj: cf. ἄγος, ‘guilt’: different is ἅγος, see √yaj.]
581: ācamana, n. the rinsing of the mouth. [√cam + ā.]
582: ācamanīya, m. dish for use in rinsing the mouth. [ācamana, 1215.]
583: ācāra, m. walk and conversation; conduct; usage; observance. [√car + ā.]
584: ācāryà, m. teacher, esp. of the Veda. [perhaps, ‘the man of observances,’ fr. ācāra, 1212d 4.]
585: ājarasám, adv. to old age. [from the phrase ā́ jarás-am.]
586: ājarasā́ya, adv. to old age. [dat. (1113) formed fr. the preceding, as if that were acc. of ājarasá.]
587: ājí, m. race; contest; battle. [√aj, 1155: cf. ἀγ-ών, ‘contest.’]
589: ā́jya, n. clarified butter (for anointing, etc.); cf. ghṛta. [√añj + ā, see 10020: for mg, cf. Eng. noun smear, ‘ointment,’ and verb smear.]
590: ājya-śeṣa, m. n. rest of the clarified butter.
591: ājyāhutí, f. oblation of clarified butter. [āhuti.]
592: ā́ñjana, n. ointment. [√añj + ā: cf. Lat. unguen, ‘ointment.’]
593: āḍhyá, a. wealthy; rich. [perhaps fr. arthya.]
594: ā́t, adv. thereupon; ā́d íd, then indeed. [lit. ‘from that,’ abl. of á, 1114a.]
597: ātmaka, for ātman in mg 4 at end of cpds [1222, 1307]; e. g. māra_ātmaka, murder-natured,  murderous.
598: ātmán, m. 	—1. breath; 	—2. spirit; soul (cf. 848N.), as principle of life and feeling; 	—3. self; very often so used as a simple reflexive pron. [514]; e. g., myself, 3616; thyself, 2615; himself, 419; in genitive: his, 1716; her, 465; one's own, 2118, 5822; 	—4. nature, character, peculiarity; esp. at end of cpds, see ātmaka; 	—5. the soul κατ᾽ ἐξοχήν, the soul of the universe,  668. [cf. ἀϋτμήν, ‘breath’; ἀτμός, ‘vapor’; AS. ǣþm, ǣðm, ‘breath’: for mg, cf. πνεῦμα and Lat. anima, ‘breath, spirit.’]
600: ātma-prabha, a. having his or their own splendor. [prabhā, 354.]
601: ātma-bhava, m. the coming into existence of one's self.
603: ātmavát, adv. as one's self. [ātma, i. e. ātman: 1107.]
606: ātma-saṃdeha, m. danger of one's self, personal risk.
608: ātmaupamya, n. likeness to one's self, i. e. a putting one's self in another's place. [aupamya.]
609: ādara, m. respect, notice, care. [√2dṛ + ā, ‘regard.’]
610: ādáhana, n. burning-place, place of cremation.  [√dah + ā.]
612: ādi, m. 	—1. in-ception, beginning, 608; ādim ādatte, he makes a beginning; ādāv eva, just before, just now; 	—2. esp. at end of adj. cpds [see 1302c 1]: …-ādi, having …as the beginning, i. e.…and so forth; or, the qualified noun being omitted, and the adj. cpd being used as subst.,…and so forth. [undoubtedly fr. √1dā + ā, ‘take,’ ‘a taking hold of, i. e. beginning,’ 1155. 2e: for mg, cf. Lat. in-cipere, Ger. an-fangen, ‘take hold of, begin.’]
613: ādika, equiv. to ādi in use 2. [1222, 1307.]
614: ādityá, m. 	—1. son of Aditi, name applied to the gods of the heavenly light, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, etc.; 	—2. Aditya,  name of the sun-god, son of Aditi; the sun. [áditi, 1211.]
617: ādya, a. first; equiv. to ādi in use 2. [ādi, 1211.]
619: ādhṛṣya, grdv. to be ventured against; approachable. [√dhṛṣ + ā, 963d.]
620: ādheya, n. a placing, esp. of the sacred fire. [√1dhā + ā, ‘put,’ 1213c.]
621: ā́dhvaryava, n. service of sacrificing priest. [adhvaryú, 1208c.]
622: ā́naḍuha, a. of a bull, taurine. [anaḍúh, weak form of anaḍvah, 404; 1208a.]
623: ānana, n. mouth; face. [prop. ‘the breather,’ √an: cf. ἠνεσ-, ‘face,’ in προσ-ηνής and ἀπ-ηνής, ‘with face turned towards, ’ ‘with face averted’: for mg, cf. nayana.]
624: √āp (āpnóti; ā́pa; ā́pat; āpsyáti; āptá; ā́ptum; āptvā́; -ā́pya; āpyáte; ī́psati [1030]; āpáyati). reach; win; get; bring upon one's self; --āptá: --1. having reached; extending over; and so, adequate,  suitable, fit; 	—2. having reached, i. e. being near or intimate, and so, as m., a friend; --īpsitá, whom or what one desires to obtain, sought for, desired. [prob. for ā-ap, 108g, see ápas: cf. ἤπιος, ‘approachable, friendly’; Lat. ap-iscor, ‘reach,’ ap-ere, ‘seize, fasten’; ἅπτω (√ἀφ for ἀπ), ‘fasten.’] + abhi, reach to a thing, attain; desid. strive to win; caus. cause to reach the mark, i. e. carry out fully, 9612. + ava, come upon, fall in with; obtain, acquire; take upon one's self; incur. + pra, reach; arrive; come upon; catch; win, obtain, get; incur; --prāpta: reached, found, caught, obtained; reached, arrived, having come; --caus. cause to arrive at, bring to, 5317; prāpaṇīya, to be brought to, 5315. + vi, reach through, pervade, 669.
626: āpad, f. misfortune. [lit. ‘a getting into’ (trouble), √pad + ā: for specialization of mg, cf. ārti, and Eng. ac-cident, lit. ‘a happening’ (of trouble).]
628: āpí, m. friend. [‘one who has reached or stands near another’ (cf. āpta), √āp: cf. ἤπιος, s. v. āp.]
629: āpta-dakṣiṇa, a. having or accompanied by suitable presents. [dakṣiṇā, 3342.]
631: ābharaṇa, n. ornament (jewels, etc.). [‘what is worn,’ √bhṛ + ā: for mg, cf. φᾶρος, ‘garment,’ w. φέρω, and Ger. Tracht, ‘dress,’ w. tragen, ‘wear.’]
632: āmá, a. raw. [cf. ὠμός, ‘raw’; Lat. amārus, ‘bitter.’]
635: āmiṣa, n. flesh. [cf. āmá and ā́mis.]
637: ā́mis, n. raw flesh; flesh. [cf. āmá.]
638: āmóda, a. gladdening; as m. fragrance. [√mud + ā.]
639: āyátana, n. foot-hold; resting-place; esp. place of the sacred fire, fire-place. [√yat + ā.]
640: ā́yata-locana, a. having long eyes. [√yam + ā.]
641: āyasá, a. metallic, of iron; as n. metal, iron. [áyas, 1208a.]
642: āyāma, m. like Eng. extent, i. e. length. [√yam + ā, ‘extend.’]
643: āyú, a. active, lively. [√i, 1178a: prob. akin are ἠύς, *ἠϳύ-ς, ἐύς, ‘active, doughty, mighty,’ εὐ-, ‘strongly,’ εὖ, generalized, ‘well’: for mg of āyú, cf. the phrase “full of go.”]
645: ā́yuṣmant, a. having life or vitality; long-lived; old. [ā́yus, 1235a.]
646: ā́yus, n. (activity, liveliness, and so) life; vitality; personified as a genius, Ayus, 8518; period or duration of life; long life; (like Eng. life, i. e.) living creatures. [√i, 1154, cf. āy-ú: cf. αἰ-ών, Lat. ae-vu-m, AS. ǣw, ǣ, ‘life-time, time’; AS. āwa, ā, Eng. aye, ‘ever’; AS. ǣf-re, Eng. ev-er.]
647: āraṇyaka, a. pertaining to the wilderness;  as n. forest-treatise (to be read in the solitude of the wilderness--Whitney, p. xvi.). [áraṇya, 1222e.]
648: ārādhana, n. the gratifying, propitiation, service. [√rādh + ā, caus.]
649: ārogya, n. lit. diseaseless-ness, i. e. health. [aroga.]
650: ārohá, m. the swelling hips or buttocks of a woman. [prop. ‘the seat’ on which a child is carried astride by its mother, √ruh + ā, ‘get upon, take one's seat upon’: see aṅka and cf. the words of an ogress, MBh., āruha mama śroṇīṃ, neṣyāmi tvāṃ vihāyasā, ‘get upon my hip, I will carry thee through the air.’]
651: ā́rta, a. visited, esp. by trouble; afflicted; stricken; distressed. [√ṛ + ā, q. v.: for mg, cf. American slang phrase gone for.]
652: ā́rti, f. a visitation (of evil), i. e. trouble, misfortune, see 9315N. [√ṛ + ā: for mg, cf. ārta and āpad.]
655: ā́rya, a. belonging to the faithful, i. e., as m., man of one's own tribe, an Aryan, as designation of a man of the Vedic Indian tribes; as adj. Aryan; noble; reverend (used in respectful address). [aryá, 1208f: cf. Avestan airya, ‘Aryan’; New Persian, īrān, ‘Persia’; Hdt. vii. 62, οἱ Μῆδοι ἐκα-λέοντο πάλαι Ἄριοι; Keltic nom. eriu, acc. erinn, name of Ireland; Eng. Ir-ish: cf. arí, aryá.]
657: ālasya-vacana, n. sloth-dictum, as designation for the ignava ratio or fatalist's argument.
661: āvís, adv. forth to sight, in view; w. kṛ, make visible. [1078.]
666: āśā́, f. hope. [younger form of āśás.]
667: ā́śā, f. region; quarter (of the sky). [specialized from ‘place, objective point, that which one reaches,’ √1aś, ‘reach.’]
670: āśís [392], f. wish or prayer, esp. for good. [√śās + ā, 639, 2252: cf. praśís.]
671: āśīr-vāda, m. expression of a (good) wish, i. e. a benediction. [āśís, cf. 392.]
672: āśīrvādābhidhānavant, a. containing a designation of a benediction. [āśīrvāda + abhidhāna, 1233.]
673: āśú, a. swift. [cf. ὠκύ-ς, ‘swift’; Lat. ōc-ior, ‘swifter.’]
675: āśrama, m. 	—1. (place of self-castigation,  i. e.) hermitage; 	—2. stadium in a Brahman's religious life (of which there are four: that of the student or brahmacārin, that of the householder or gṛhastha, that of the hermit or vānaprastha, and that of the beggar or bhikṣu), see 653N. [√śram + ā.]
676: āśraya, m. that on which anything leans or rests; support; refuge; protection; authority. [√śri + ā.]
677: āśraya-bhūta, a. having become a protection,  i. e., as m., protector. [1273c.]
678: ās, excl. of joy or of displeasure. ah!
679: √ās (ā́ste [628], ā́sīna [6193]; āsā́ṃ cakre; ā́siṣṭa; āsiṣyáte; āsitá; ā́situm; āsitvā́; -ā́sya). 	—1. sit; seat one's self; settle down, 931; 	—2. abide; dwell, 8519; stay; remain; continue, 6414; 	—3. w. ppl. [1075c], continue (doing anything), keep on, 3214, 18. [cf. ἦσ-ται, ‘sits’; Lat. ānus, *ās-nu-s, ‘seat, buttocks’; Old Lat. āsa, Lat. āra, ‘family-seat, hearth, altar.’] + adhi, take one's place in, i. e. visit, 4916; get into (shoes), i. e. put on, 4517. + upa, sit by (in sign of readiness to serve), wait upon (a command), 924; sit by (expectantly), sit waiting for, 914. + pary-upa, sit around, surround, 27.
681: āsāra, m. (like Eng. colloq. a pour, i. e.) pouring rain. [√sṛ + ā, ‘run.’]
682: āsurá, a. demonic; as m. demon. [ásura, 1208f.]
683: āsécana, n. cavity (into which one pours). [√sic + ā.]
684: āsecanavant, a. having a cavity, hollow. [āsecana.]
688: āhavanī́ya, a. of or for the oblation; w. agni, oblation-fire; as m., without agni, oblation-fire (the one that receives the oblation), see 1022N. [āhavana, 1215.]
689: āhāra, m. the taking to one's self (of food), eating; what one takes, i. e. food. [√hṛ + ā.]
692: āhārādi, n. food and so forth. [ādi, 1302c 1.]
694: ā́hitāgni, a. having a set or established fire; as m. one who is keeping alive a sacred fire. [āhita, √1dhā + ā, ‘set’: 1299a.]
695: ā́huti, f. oblation, offering (used both of the act and of the thing offered); cf. the later word homa. [√hu + ā: w. -huti, cf. χύ-σι-ς, ‘a pouring.’]
696: āhvāna, n. call; invitation. [√hū or hvā + ā.]
697: i, pron. root, see idam and 5023.
698: √i (éti [612]; iyā́ya, īyús [783b2]; eṣyáti; itá; étum; itvā́; -ítya). 	—1. go; go to or towards; come; enter; 	—2. move on, 8612; pass; 	—3. go to, i. e. attain (a thing or condition); --ī́yase [10212], goest hither and thither, 9015; --īmahe [10212], (like Ger. an-gehen) we approach with prayers, beseech. [w. i-más, cf. ἴ-μεν, Lat. i-mus, ‘we go’; Goth. i-ddja, AS. eode, ‘went’; radically akin, perhaps, is AS. gān (stem gā for *ga-i, ga- being the inseparable prefix), Eng. go, Ger. gehen: see also āyú, ā́yus.] + ati, go beyond or past or over; overwhelm;  transcend; leave behind, get rid of, 689; escape. + adhi, come upon, notice; take notice, 8718; --middle adhīté [612 note], go over for one's self, repeat, learn, read; ppl. adhīta: w. act. mg, learn-ed, 186; w. pass. mg, learnt, 2115; --caus. adhyāpáyati [1042e], cause to learn, teach. + upa_adhi, in upādhyāya. + anu, go along or after; accompany; ppl. anvita, accompanied by, endowed or filled or connected with. + sam-anu, the same. + antar, go within; retire, withdraw. + apa, go off; slink away. + abhi, go unto; become embodied in. + ava, approach. + ā, come near or unto or hither; w. the adv. punar, go back. + abhy-ā, approach, go near. + upa_ā, come unto. + sam-ā, come near to together; assemble. + ud, go up, rise (of the sun). + upa, go unto; fall to the lot of; ppl. upeta, gone unto, attended by, provided with. + sam-upa, come hither. + ni, go into or in; cf. nyāya. + parā, go away or forth; depart. + anu-parā, go forth along (a path). + vi-parā, go away separately. + pari, circumambulate; walk round (the fire). + pra, 	—1. go forward or onward, 8311; esp. go forth out of this world, and so (like Eng. depart), die; pretya, after dying, i. e. in the other world (opp. of iha); preta, dead; 	—2. come out, stick out, be prominent. + prati, go against, withstand; go back to; recognize, 9816; pratīta, recognized, approved. + vi, go asunder; separate; disperse, 8315; spread one's self over, i. e. pervade, 722; vīta, at beg. of cpds, having departed…, i. e. free from…. + sam, come together; assemble.
699: icchā, f. wish; desire; inclination. [√1iṣ, ‘seek’: cf. AS. ǣsce, ‘an asking.’]
702: ítara [523], pron. a. other; the other; another; other than, i. e. different from, w. abl. [pron. root i, 5023: cf. Lat. iterum, ‘another time.’]
703: itás, adv. 	—1. used like the abl. of a pron. [1098c2], 2418; 	—2. from this (place), from here; here; from this (world), 58; itas tatas, here and there; 	—3. from this (time), now, 418. [pron. root i, 5023.]
704: íti, adv. see 1102a. 	—1. in this way, thus; so; iti devā akurvan, thus the gods did, 969; 	—2. used w. all kinds of quotations made verbis ipsissimis: tathā_ity uktvā, upon saying “Yes,” 42; sa pṛṣṭavān kau yuvām iti, he asked, “Who are ye,” 455; evam astu iti tau dhāvitau, with the words, “So be it,” the two ran off, 4516; so RV., 8512; so MS., 9215; ity ākarṇya, on hearing (so, i. e.) the preceding ślokas, 1716; cf. 1810; 	—2a. designating something as that which was, or under the circumstances might have been said or thought or intended or known, sometimes (4616) preceding it, but usually following it: martavyam iti, at the thought, “I must die,” 299; gardabho 'yam iti jñātvā, recognizing (the fact), “This is an ass,” 3420; 	—2b. interr. in place of the exact quotation: kim iti, alleging or intending what, under what pretext, with what intention, 304, 415; 	—2c. used in giving an authority: iti dhāraṇā, so (is) the rule, 6217; ity eke, so some folks (say), 1019; 	—2d. used in citing a Vedic verse by its first word (6013) or words (9820, etc.); 	—2e. at the end of a section or book (cf. atha), here endeth, 44; 	—2f. w. verbs of naming, considering, etc., the predicate, marked by iti, is nom., sometimes acc.--both constructions at 6122; damayantī_iti viśrutā, known as or named “D.,” 63; 	—3. used to include under one head or as in a list several separate objects, 217, 1008, 1057; 	—4. evam superfluously added, 6112; iti doubled, 6011; 	—5. iti ha = iti, 128, 6118. [pron. root i, 1102a: cf. Lat. itidem, ‘just so.’]
705: itihāsá, m. story, legend. [agglomeration of iti ha āsa, ‘thus, indeed, it was’: 1314b.]
706: itthā́ (V. only) and itthám, adv. in this way; so; kíṃ ta itthā́, how does this happen thee ? 738. [adverbs made from the acc. sing. neut., i-d, of the pron. root i, see 1101: cf. Lat. itā and item, ‘so.’]
707: ity-ādi, at end of possessive adj. cpds used substantively, that which has “…” as its beginning, i. e. “…” and so forth. [see 1302c 1 end.]
708: íd, V. pcl. just; exactly; even; emphasizing the preceding word and to be rendered by laying emphasis on that word. [acc. of pron. root i, 1111a: cf. Lat. i-d, ‘it.’]
709: 1idám [501--2 --forms made from four stems, á and aná, í and imá, those from á being often unaccented, see 749 N.], pron. this, this here, τόδε, e. g. 209, 8610, 878; contrasted w. asau, ‘that one,’ 1037; asmin loke, in this world, 6612; without loke and contrasted w. amutra, 1038; idaṃ viśvam bhuvanam, this whole world, 8512; idaṃ sarvam, this entire (world), 6321; so 6619; so idam, τὸ πᾶν, 5615, 17; iyam pṛthivī, this earth, 1010; iyam alone, this earth, 931, 2; --refers very often, like τάδε, to something following (just as etad and ταῦτα to something preceding), e. g. 1322, 267, 4514, 516; occasionally refers to something immediately preceding, e. g. 1017, 249, 7412, 794; --joined w. pronouns: ko 'yam āyāti, who comes here ? 2712; yo 'yaṃ dṛśyate, which is seen here, 4617; mām imam, me here, 7616; nom. to be rendered here is or are, 561, 421; imau vātas, blow hither, 9012. [cf. Lat. i-d, Goth. i-ta, Ger. es, ‘it.’]
712: √idh or indh (inddhé [694]; īdhé [783b]; aíndhiṣṭa; indhiṣyáti; iddhá; -ídhya). kindle. [cf. αἴθ-ω, ‘burn’; Lat. aed-e-s, ‘fire-place, hearth, dwelling’ (cf. stove and Ger. Stube, ‘room’); aestus, *aid-tu-s, ‘heat’; AS. ād, ‘funeral pile’; āst, Eng. oast, ‘kiln for drying hops or malt.’] + sam, kindle, trans. and intrans.
713: idhmá, m. fuel. [√idh, 1166: for mg, cf. Eng. kindlings.]
715: √in (in-ó-ti, prop. i-nó-ti [713]). drive; force; in enas. [cf. √inv.]
716: índra, m. Indra, name of a Vedic god; in the later language, the best of its kind, chief, prince. [none of the numerous proposed derivations is satisfactory.]
717: índra-purogama, a. having Indra as leader, preceded by Indra. [1302c 2.]
719: índra-śatru, a. having Indra as his conqueror. [1302.]
720: indra-senā́, f. Indra's missile weapon; personified as his bride, RV. x. 102. 2; hence, name of a woman, see 1611N.; --m. -a, name of a man, formed as a mere pendant to the fem. [índra + 1 sénā.]
721: indrāgní, m. Indra and Agni. [índra + agní: acct, 1255b.]
723: indrāyudha, n. Indra's weapon, the rainbow. [āyudha.]

726: √inv (ínvati). drive; send. [secondary root from i, 749b, 716: cf. in.]

733: íriṇa, n. a run or runlet; gulch; gullied and so desert land. [√ṛ, 1177b: for mg, cf. Provincial Eng. run, ‘brook.’]
734: iva, encl. pcl. 	—1. as; like; 	—2. used to modify a strong expression, in a manner; so to speak, 5616; as it were, 110; perhaps; almost, 3413; 	—3. sometimes (like eva), just, quite; nacirād iva, right soon. [pron. root i, 1102b.]
735: √liṣ (iccháti [753]; iyéṣa, īṣús [783b]; aíṣīt; eṣiṣyáti; iṣṭá; éṣṭum; -íṣya). seek; desire; esp. w. inf. [9813]; pass. be desired; be approved or recognized, and so pass for, 5918; iṣṭá, desired, i. e. desirable,  14. [radical mg, ‘go, go for,’ √2iṣ being merely a causative of √1iṣ: cf. ἵμερος, *ἴμμερος, ‘desire’; w. icchā, ‘desire,’ cf. AS. *āsce, ‘petition,’ whence āscian, Ger. (h)eischen, Eng. ask: icchati for *isskati, cf. √vāñch.] + anu, seek after. + abhi, seek for; ppl. abhīṣṭa, desired, dear, 2118.
736: √2iṣ (iṣáyati [1042a2]; also íṣyati [761c]; iyéṣa, īṣús [783b]; iṣitá; íṣayitum; -íṣya). send; set in swift motion; impel,  7419. [caus. of √1iṣ, q. v.] + pra, 	—1. preṣáyati: send forth; send, e. g. 910; 	—2. préṣyati: drive forth, impel; start up (e. g. game); praiṣam [970a] aicchan, sought to start up, 9316; and so 	—3. préṣyati: call upon or summon (technical term used of the chief priest's calling upon another to begin a text or action), 1036.

745: íṣṭi, f. sacrifice (simple offering of butter,  fruit, etc.), 1016. [√yaj, 252, 1157. 1a.]
746: ihá, adv. here, opp. of atra (871) and amutra (646); hither, 92; here on earth, ici bas, 272; opp. of pretya (√i), 592, 5817; in this book, 176; w. loc. [cf. 10994], iha samaye, in this case, 4110, 4215. [pron. root i, 1100a.]
747: √īkṣ (ī́kṣate; īkṣā́ṃ cakre; aíkṣiṣṭa; īkṣiṣyáte; īkṣitá; ī́kṣitum; īkṣitvā́; -ī́kṣya; īkṣyáte). look; look at; see; behold. [desid. of √*aś, ‘see,’ contained in ak-ṣán, ‘eye,’ etc., 108g: see akṣán.] + apa, look off to (like Ger. es absehen auf); regard; expect. + ava, look after; look after one's self, i. e. look behind or around. + upa, w. two mgs, like Eng. overlook: 	—1. look over, i. e. inspect; and 	—2. (more commonly) look beyond, i. e. neglect. + nis, look out or after; contemplate. + pari, look about one; investigate; consider. + vi, look; look on; vīkṣita, beheld. + sam, look upon; behold; perceive.
750: √īṅkh (ī́ṅkhati, -te; īṅkháyati, -te [10412]). move unsteadily. + pra, rock or pitch onward.
751: √īḍ (ī́ḻe, ī́ḻiṣe, ī́ṭṭe [628, 630]; perf. īḻé; īḻitá). supplicate; call upon; praise. [Whitney, 54.]

756: √īr (ī́rte [628]; īrṇá; īráyati, -te; īritá). set one's self in motion; --caus. set in motion; cause to go forth, i. e.: 	—1. bring into existence; 	—2. utter (a sound), 1423. [near akin w. √ṛ.] + ud, rise up; caus. rouse; send out; utter; announce, 5316. + sam-ud, caus. utter, declare. + pra, caus. drive or steer onward (ship). + sam, caus. bring together, i. e. into shape or being; create, 756; sameriré, established (as an ordinance), instituerunt, 885N.

761: √īṣ (ī́ṣate; īṣé; īṣitá). hasten from, flee before, w. abl. [if not desid. of √i (108g1 end), perhaps akin w. √1iṣ, orig. ‘go.’]
762: u, Vedic encl. copula. 	—1. and; also; further;  used in one (oftenest the latter) of two clauses or sentences containing things alike or slightly contrasted (e. g. 7814, 799), esp. in anaphora (e. g. 795, 909); 	—2. now, straightway,  w. verbs present and past and w. imperatives or imperative subjunctives, 7110, 8515, 855, 878; often followed by sú, right soon; --pragṛhya [see 1122a2, 138c] when combined with átha (9016), úpa (7814), mā́ (878); for 839 and 8411, see notes; 	—3. in classical Skt. only w. (atha, kim, and) na, and not, 2114, 2717.
766: ukthá, n. utterance, esp. of devotion; praise; hymn of praise; invocation. [√vac, 1163a.]
767: uktha-várdhana, a. strengthening, i. e. refreshing or delighting one's self with hymns of praise. [acct, 1271.]
768: √ukṣ [252] or vakṣ (ukṣáti, -te; aúkṣīt; ukṣiṣyáti; ukṣitá; -úkṣya). sprinkle; besprinkle; drop, intrans., 757. [secondary form (108g end) of √*uj or ug: cf. ὑγ-ρός, ‘wet’; Lat. ūvens (*ugvens) caelum, ‘the dropping sky’; w. ukṣán, ‘besprinkler, impregnator, bull,’ cf. 781: utá, conj. and; also; even; connecting words, clauses, and sentences; repeated: uta…uta…(uta), both…and…(and); at beg. of verse, 7812; --uta vā: or even, 8720; or, 8414 (cf. atha, 6); apy uta, also.
783: uttamá, a. 	—1. up-most; highest; best, esp. at end of cpds; excellent; chief; 	—2. (out-most, i. e.) ut-most; extreme; last (see 676N.), 9920. [úd, ‘up, out,’ 473.]

786: úttara [5252], a. upper; higher; 	—1. being above, (opp. adhara) 7018; having the upper hand, victorious, 8121; 	—2. northern (on account of the Himālayas, cf. udañc); ā_uttarasmāt, as far as the north (side), 10510; 	—3. the left (because in prayer the face is turned eastward: cf. dakṣiṇa), 9922; 	—4. (like ὕστερος) the latter (opp. pūrva); later; following, 9922; -am, as adv. finally, last, 10412; 	—5. as neuter subst. the final element of a phrase of salutation, 603; 	—6. answer, retort.
